data.snippet: Ha Dong-kyun has actively participated in charitable activities, particularly those supporting children and environmental causes. In January 2017, he attended a UNICEF event held at a KBS hall in Seoul, aimed at raising support for impoverished children worldwide. More recently, in December 2025, he performed on the variety show Hangout with Yoo, contributing to its seventh consecutive charity drive that donated 360 million won to various social welfare organizations. Additionally, in June 2023, he took part in the Seowon Valley Charity Free Green Concert, a unique event held on a golf course to promote environmental conservation, with all proceeds directed toward global nature protection projects. Beyond philanthropy, Ha Dong-kyun engages with fans through social media, maintaining an [...] Ha Dong-kyun (Korean: 하동균; born June 28, 1980), professionally known as Ha Dong Qn, is a South Korean singer-songwriter recognized for his distinctive husky voice and emotive power ballads. Active in the K-pop industry for over two decades, he has built a career spanning group performances, solo releases, and television appearances, earning acclaim for his vocal depth and songwriting. Ha began his music career in 2002 as a member of the short-lived boy band 7Dayz, which disbanded shortly after debut. In 2004, he joined the YG Entertainment group Wanted, releasing their debut album before the group entered a three-year hiatus following the tragic death of member Seo Jae-hyo in a car accident. His debut EP, Mark, arrived on December 17, 2012, under WS Entertainment, ending a five-year absence from solo projects since his 2008 album Another Corner. The five-track set, led by the single "From Mark," emphasized introspective themes of indelible life moments and emotional introspection, with Ha Dong-kyun's signature husky timbre driving tracks like "Indelible" and "Unbelievable Word." data.snippet: Ha Dong-kyun (Korean: 하동균; born June 28, 1980), known professionally as Ha Dong Qn, is a South Korean singer-songwriter known for his deep vocal timbre, wide range, and emotive ballad performances that have established him as a respected vocalist in the Korean music industry.   Born on June 28, 1980, in Seoul, he debuted in 2002 as a member of the short-lived vocal group 7Dayz before joining the boy band Wanted in 2004, where he has continued to perform despite intermittent hiatuses over the years.   His solo career began in 2006 with the release of the single album DQ from WANTED, followed by notable works including the studio albums Stand Alone (2006) and Another Corner (2008), as well as the EPs Mark (2012), Word (2014), and Polygon (2017).  Ha has further broadened his recognition [...] In 2016, Ha Dong-kyun founded the independent record label Mark Planet, allowing him greater creative control over his music following his earlier solo work. Under this label, he released the mini album Polygon on May 11, 2017, consisting of five tracks including "Beautiful Things," "The Maze of Reality," and collaborations that showcased his evolving R&B style.  The album received positive reception and marked his first major release as an independent artist. Ha Dong-kyun has since focused on consistent single releases and live performances. He held his inaugural solo concert series Night: The First in June 2017 at Blue Square iMarket Hall.  Subsequent solo concerts have included Here I Am in October 2021 at Blue Square Mastercard Hall, ROOTS in November 2023, and PIECE in December 2024, [...] Ha Dong-kyun has contributed to numerous original soundtracks for Korean television dramas, providing emotive ballad performances that align with the emotional narratives of the series. His OST work spans multiple genres, from historical and romantic dramas to medical and thriller productions, often highlighting his powerful vocal delivery and ability to convey deep sentiment. Among his notable contributions is the duet "I Will Be Waiting" (기다릴게) with Lee Jung for the 2011 MBC historical drama The Princess' Man.  The track gained attention for its heartfelt lyrics. In the same year, he released "After The Love" for the SBS romantic comedy Twinkle Twinkle. Ha Dong-kyun (Korean: 하동균; born June 28, 1980), officially known as Ha Dong Qn, is a South Korean singer-songwriter. He debuted in 2002 as a member of the short-lived boy band 7Dayz, before joining the boy band Wanted "Wanted (South Korean band)") in 2004. As a solo singer, he has released two albums: Stand Alone (2006) and Another Corner (2008), and three extended plays: Mark (2012), Word (2014), and Polygon (2017).

## Career

[edit] [...] Dong Qn embarked on his career as a solo singer with the release of his first album Stand Alone in 2006. He has since followed his debut album with the release of his second full-length album Another Corner (2008) as well as multiple singles and mini albums including Mark (2012) and Word (2014). Dong Qn attracted substantial audience attention from his appearance on a popular South Korean singing competition TV program I Am a Singer (Season 3, aired in 2015). In 2016, Ha Dong Qn founded the independent record label Mark Planet, under which he then released his new mini album Polygon, consisting of five single tracks, on May 11, 2017.
